Such are the feelings of these wood savageS‚ though they think it neither irrational nor improper to marry many wives, and reject them whenever they like.

Another admirable trait in the character of the savage Abipones is their conjugal fidelity. You never hear of this being shaken, or even attempted. Husbands are many months absent from their homes, whilst their wives remain in the midst of a horde of men without danger or even suspicion. What the Greeks have sabled of Penelope, who continued faithful to her hus- band Ulysses during an absence of twenty years, is the true history of the Abiponian women.
